overview:
Mache Creeger is a 30-year computer industry veteran based in Silicon Valley and has worked in business development, product marketing, and product management roles for Sun, MIPS, Sony, and InstallShield as well as smaller startups. He is currently the principal of Emergent Technology Associates, providing business development and marketing consulting focusing on emerging application and network infrastructure products and technologies.

Mache has made a career out of understanding new emerging technologies, the markets they serve, the alternative technologies and products they compete with, and the value proposition they represent to customers. His strength is to understand and articulate the market value around core technology assets and develop, manage, and execute successful strategy and tactics to maximize that value.

Mache has also been the founder, moderator, and head wrangler for the Association for Computing Machineryâ€™s (ACM - http://www.acm.org) CTO Roundtable series on contemporary issues in commercial computing, a committee chair on ACM’s Professions Board, and a columnist for ACM Queue magazine. He has authored a total of 23 published articles and has a Masters degree in Computer Science.
